title: Ant McPartlin's ex-wife Lisa Armstrong 'gets role as guest judge on Stacey Dooley's show Glow Up'
text:
She has impressed viewers with her incredible make-up skills on Strictly Come Dancing and her tutorials on spin-off show It Takes Two.

And Ant McPartlin's ex-wife Lisa Armstrong has reportedly landed a role as a guest judge on Stacey Dooley's BBC Three show Glow Up.

According to reports, the make-up artist, 42, has already started filming on the talent series which follows ten make-up artists on their journey to become Britain's next make-up star.

Exciting: Ant McPartlin's ex-wife Lisa Armstrong has reportedly landed a role as a guest judge on Stacey Dooley's BBC Three show Glow Up

With different creative briefs each week, they will need to impress Val Garland (Global Make-Up Director for L’Oreal Paris), Dominic Skinner (Global Senior Artist for MAC) and expert guest judges in order to make it to the final.

A source told The Sun: 'When Lisa was with Ant she very much took the back seat. He was the TV star and a career on screen didn’t massively appeal to her.

'But she has been truly scooped up by the BBC and her Strictly family so when this offer came through to be a guest judge on Stacey’s show Glow Up, and it was the Beeb, she jumped at the chance.

'She's really good on camera and is a leader in the make-up industry, so it makes sense.'

Fun: According to reports, the make-up artist, 42, has already started filming on the talent series which follows ten make-up artists on their journey to become Britain's next make-up star and is hosted by Stacey Dooley (pictured)

MailOnline has contacted BBC and Lisa's representative for comment.

Lisa is currently head of make-up and hair on Strictly Come Dancing and she gives beauty tutorials on spin-off show It Takes Two, she previously worked on Britain's Got Talent.

While Glow Up, which was announced last year and hosted by Stacey, sees ten contestants live and work together as they compete to win a contract assisting some of the world's biggest make-up artists.

With different creative briefs each week, they will need to impress Val, Dominic and expert guest judges from worlds such as fashion and film, in order to make it to the final.

Busy bee: According to reports, the make-up artist, 42, has already started filming on the talent series which follows ten make-up artists on their journey to become Britain's next make-up star

Earlier this year, host Stacey responded to criticism that her latest presenting gig was 'trivial' compared to her investigative reporting in places like Iraq.

She told the Mail on Sunday's YOU magazine that after some of her more grim programmes, 'it seemed really important to me to be at home and enjoy some escapism'.

And responding to the backlash, she said: ‘It’s painfully predictable. There are always people who are desperate to put you in your one camp and never let you leave.

'The idea that you could be interested in the Yazidi community and also in lipstick blows people’s minds.

'It’s a really short-sighted, Stone Age attitude – it’s boring, actually.'
